key_points: A false claim circulated on social media stating former President Bill Clinton was poisoned to death at Guantanamo Bay.
Bill Clinton was actually hospitalized in California for a non-COVID-related infection, specifically sepsis.
The false claim is part of a broader pattern of fabricated stories about high-profile figures, often linked to the baseless QAnon conspiracy theory.
The claim originated from Real Raw News, a website known for publishing fake stories and conspiracy theories.
Bill Clinton was released from the hospital and returned to New York to continue his antibiotic treatment.
Clinton's spokesperson, Angel Ureña, confirmed his health was improving and that he was in excellent spirits.
Real Raw News falsely reported Clinton's death, attributing the information to an unnamed source at Guantanamo Bay and fictitious involvement of a U.S. Naval Hospital officer.
The hospital spokesperson, Dawn Grimes, refuted claims about an autopsy performed or overseen by Capt. Dale Ramirez.
Real Raw News has a disclaimer stating its content contains humor, parody, and satire, but it's noted this is hidden on the about page.
Fact-checking investigation by PolitiFact attributes these stories to Michael Ruffin, who uses the pseudonym Michael Baxter and defends the accuracy of his stories despite the satire disclaimer.
spokespersons: Dawn Grimes (Spokeswoman, U.S. Naval Hospital in Guantanamo Bay)
